Reviews.Title: “Beyond our wildest dreams”
Reviews.Author: OntarioTraveller48
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 glorious days at the Blue Diamond. Our every expectation was exceeded. We were the 153rd and 154th guests since the opening. Everything that we could have hoped for was available. The service was the best we have ever had anywhere....even better than at home. There was nothing we could ask for that they couldn't bring or do for us. Breakfast, lunch and dinner from a menu with a good variety of choices. The fresh fruit was served up perfectly sliced and looking like a piece of art. Even our order from the snack bar was delivered right to our sunbed on china plates and real cutlery. The bar had PREMIUM drinks and concoctions including Crown Royal and Grey Goose. Our room was more like a palace with 3 sets of wide patio doors across the back viewing out to the mangroves which our own private patio overlooked and contained table, chairs, loungers and our own private tub. We had a very comfortable king size bed, comfy couch and chairs, desk, walk-in closet/dressing room, good-size flat screen with IPOD connection for music, etc. We came home wanting to revamp our house to replicate the bathroom from Blue Diamond....his/her showers, makeup desk, beautiful tile, very modern and clean. The bathrobes and slippers were just icing on the already perfect cake. A roof top cigar bar was a great spot for the evening hours. Plenty of room to get fresh air if you don't smoke. Even did some dancing. Very accomodating staff. Again the service was 6 star. The staff were superb. The transportation driver came right to our door to inform us that he was ready to take us to the beach, or pool, or restaurant or lobby. We never waited more than 3 minutes. We absolutely loved this resort. So much so, that my hubby never turned the TV on!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful end to a perfect holiday”
Reviews.Author: megjazzStaffordshire
Reviews.Content: My husband and i spent the last three days of our holiday at the beautiful BLUE DIAMOND by Blue Bay resort what a fantastic place it is,from first arriving at the resort the staff could not do enough for you,nothing is a problem for them,you never have to walk anywhere if don`t want to, the reception are always making sure that everything is to your satisfaction and if you need anything else in your room to what time would you like picking up for your meals.When we came back to our room on the first morning after we had been on the beach there was champage on ice wating for us same on the second day never have we been on holiday where we have been made to feel so welcome.The staff are the best ever,Saturday morning we were served breakfast by Romeo he also served us for our evening meal along with Martin we were also served on Sunday evening by Romeo and Martin and they never stop trying to please you,nothing is any problem to them,all the staff from housekeeping,gardeners right to the highest rank never stop pleasing you. The villas are breathtaking from first entering,we stayed in the Laguna Villas. What a way to end your holiday ......

Reviews.Title: “The best of the best”
Reviews.Author: john o
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I just spent 5 days at Blue Diamond. It was beyond belief. You don't get a room, you get a palace. The food is delicious, breakfast lunch and dinner (their wine list is thin...but hey). The staff are there for your every wish. One of the biggest complaints my partner and I have had in our Caribbean travel is that the rooms are "clean but sterile" - there is no dirt...but you feel like you are in a motel 6. Not here. The bed is very very comfortable. The lighting is nice. The room (one of the smallest at the resort) was HUGE. With its own living room, giant two shower bathroom, outdoor bathtub, and patio/backyard with recliners and a view of the cenote. it was like staying in the guest house of a rich relative, not a "functional" hotel room. The spa is magnificent and even if you don't want to pay for treatments the time in the therapeutic pool, the Hamam (steam room) and relaxation room drinking chlorophyll water was perfect. The pool is great with a great view of the ocean, and nice chairs. perfect. But, the top notch is the people who work here. They are from all over Mexico, are extremely friendly, and make you feel like an honored guest. My partner and I have been to Mexico, St. Maarten, Miami, Aruba, and nothing, nothing even came close to the luxury, relaxation, comfort, friendliness, and service of the Blue Diamond. It was sublime - if what you want is low key and luxury. it's not a party scene at all.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff make for a great experience”
Reviews.Author: anygelina
Reviews.Content: I just arrived home from a 5 day stay at the resort. It has only been open for a few weeks so they are still working out some kinks. One day there was no water but that was remedied quickly and another day the hot water did not work. I think this is normal for a new hotel a few weeks in. I'm sure if I visited in a couple of months I'd give it a 5/5 but I need to be honest a few weeks in it wasn't perfect. I love that it is an adult-only hotel and it has a great, modern feel. I appreciate that some people have families but I don't want to vacation with them! The Ambar restaurant is beautiful and the food is delicious. But what really makes it a great stay is the wonderful staff. The helpfulness went beyond the duty of normal resort staff. When I arrived I asked that they speak Spanish so I could practice. They kindly spoke slowly and at my level. Moreover when I wanted to go off the resort they recommended great places for me to go. I will remember them all fondly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice relaxing Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Jim G
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from 5 great days at the Blue Diamond. The resort was pretty empty when we arrived. The staff told us there was only 13 guests there, although about 40 or so more showed up on our last day there. The food was excellent, the staff was excellent, the room was excellent, and the grounds were excellent. The beach can be a walk if you stay where we stayed, room 367, but there is transportation available at your request, all the drivers were great, only name I remember is Omar, but the rest were awesome to. All the wait staff was excellent, Manuel was probably our favorite, but the rest were awesome, just don't remember all the names. We've been to the Riviera Maya about 7 times in the last 4 years, and we usually say we would go back to each resort, but probably will not, this resort I can say I will be back, I am curious to see what its like when its running at full capacity. Also, would like say that every issue we had was handled immediately, whether it was a clogged toilet or no hot water, staff was immediately working on it, most resorts you have to call about 10 times. The only issues we had was no hot water for one day and no water at all the morning we left, but they were working on it and also when we arrived there was no one there to greet us or carry our luggage, not a big deal, probably just an oversight as other guests said they were greeted. Also, the beach needed a little tlc, but in their defense the water was really rough and churning up a lot of stuff, red flags were out every day we were there. I would definitely recommend this resort if you are wanting a nice quiet, relaxing vacation, if you are looking for a resort to do cannon balls in the pool, drink from your bubba keg at the pool, have blaring music at the pool, and sit at the swim up bar all day, then this is not the resort for you. Thanks again to all the staff for a wonderful vacation.

Reviews.Title: “The Very Best”
Reviews.Author: DavidkMassachusetts
Reviews.Content: As I read the reviews i agree with what was written, We were lucky enough to have a beach villa. The view is incredible . The staff the best . The food was outsanding.. This is the ultimate in resorts. The villa itself is the best with double showers, jaccuzi whirpool and duel vanitys. The idea of this resort is get away from it all and it does as a relaxing and restfull as you can find. It is a adults only and words really do not justice to Blue Bay Diamond

Reviews.Title: “Words cannot describe!”
Reviews.Author: SparkesCoombs
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the BLUE DIAMOND by Bluebay. This was the most amazing place! Lush grounds with a dedication to the natural wildlife, this place is paradise on earth. A dedicated staff are there for your every wish. We celebrated our anniversary and were treated to cake and drinks under the stars just for us. Amazing suites with lovely outdoor beds (complete with shower outside) and amazing views of the beach, our own lagoon, or a natural cenote (which was breathtaking!). Beautiful large windows, the most amazing drinks and food, this is where you need to stay! Pristine white sand beach and two infinity pools complete the decadence. We loved this so much that we plan on getting married there next year (and we had sworn off the idea of a destination wedding previous to our arrival here).

Reviews.Title: “Pics don't lie”
Reviews.Author: kyan2012
Reviews.Content: I was recently stayed at the Blue Diamond Riviera Maya and what an awesome place it is, rooms with elegantly decorated, 4 bottles of prime liquors in the minibar, and I got a room face a lagoon, and from my rooftop terrace you can see the ocean. Food was amazing, specially at the Ambar restaurant. Hotel has a fresh water Mayan cenote, but you can't swim in there.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Miracle in the Riviera Maya”
Reviews.Author: Gofish247
Reviews.Content: I am horrible, I meant to write this almost 2 years ago, but I have never got around to it. It's been on my mind and based on the amazing service and help that we received by the staff at the Mandarin Oriental, I can't put this off any longer. So here goes... we planned our wedding at another very nice hotel (much larger than the MO) in the Riviera Maya and it went horribly wrong. We flew down ahead of time to scope out all our potential sites and decided that while we loved the MO, we'd save a little by going with our other option ("Hotel to Remain Anonymous") that had a little more to do for some of our guests and we would apply the savings to our honeymoon. It was a terrible decision. After months of dealing with "Hotel to Remain Anonymous" who were giving us nothing but bait and switch, lies, fraud and continually beating us up with additional miscellaneous fees unsubstantiated fees, we told "Hotel to Remain Anonymous" that we were cancelling our wedding and telling our friends we were cancelling their airfare and room reservations. "Hotel to Remain Anonymous", basically said "yea right, try it. No one cancels their wedding with less than 3 weeks left." Well apparently, we were the first and I was never happier with our last minute decision. We called the Mandarin Oriental that very same day, explained the situation, and asked if they could help us out before we would have to tell our guests that the whole adventure had been cancelled. Enter our Angels in the Riviera Maya, the incredible and amazing, Mauricio and Roxana. They told us not to worry, and they assured us that they would take care of everything for us. They asked a few questions, followed up with us for additional information when necessary and went to work behind the scenes making sure that everything would be ready for us and our guests. They not only took care of everything, they addressed everything with the professionalism and thoroughness that would have made the most obsessive compulsive sufferer comfortable. They arranged for limo pick-ups for our guests, took care of all of the menus, the cake, the photographer, flowers, hair, makeup, massages, Mariachi band, dj, costs, billing, etc., etc., etc. What was agreed between us and the MO was delivered, with no disappointments. They were divine. We went from 6 months of struggling with the planning dream team at "Hotel to Remain Anonymous" where even my Mexican born fiance’ couldn’t get them to understand in Spanish what they were supposed to be doing, and what they had promised us and written in their own contract, to working with total professionals that put us at ease. In short, we went from total devastation to total elation by switching to the MO. With less than 3 weeks remaining on the calendar for our wedding date, everything fell miraculously into place, without any stress (at least on our part). ;) We told our guests we had changed venues, but there would be no impact to them and that we’d see them down there at our wedding. When they got there, they were thoroughly pleased with the hotel, the grounds, the service, the beach and the staff (that somehow knew everyone of our names by heart). Our wedding was amazing, our guests were astounded, the food was spectacular and there was absolutely nothing that disappointed us. Prior to the wedding, the MO helped arrange for us a private tour guide and bus to go to Chichen Itza and again, it was worry free and comfort and enjoyment filled. The MO staff catered to our every whim, and they treated us fairly and honestly throughout the entire process. If I ever get married again (just kidding honey), I would do it again at the MO in Riviera Maya. They were beyond exceptional and I would highly recommend them to anyone that ever asked the question, and now you understand why I am writing this review almost two years later. After all they did for us, writing a review on TripAdvisor is the absolute least that I can do to show our appreciation for the wonderful staff that peformed a wedding miracle for us in the Mayan Riviera. From the bottom of our hearts, thank you MO, Mauricio and Roxana, we will always be indebted to you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: chloe4245
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Mandarin Oriental for a week. The hotel staff is friendly and efficient. We were greetediat a beautiful front desk by Fred Boutouba - the Guest Experience and Quaility Manager. The check-in was quickly done and we were greeted with drinks and homemade popcicles. There are golf carts to take you to the rooms, beach, front desk, spa and restaurants. We never waited long for a cart and had the option of calling ahead to get a ride from the helpful staff. We ate at 2 of the restaurants - both provided good service and the food quaility was excellent. The room was amazing. I especially liked the bathroom which had 2 rainhead showers and a bathtub outside - which you requested to have ready at a specified time. We had a very private patio area outside of our room, great for kicking back or catching some sun. I appreciated the fresh flowers and fruit in the room. We also had a fridge - nice to keep a few things cold when we went to the store. The spa and gym facilities were amazing. I enjoyed the steam room, showers and vitality pool everyday. The spa staff was very accomodating and provided me fresh aloe vera gel for my sunburn - so soothing The gym's equipment was top-notch and the gym was never overcrowded. I always got the machine I wanted. They also offer yoga, I borrowed a mat and used it in my room. Fred, was a pleasure to interact with along with the other staff. My favourite driver was Roman. The staff at the pool and beach were very friendly and attentive, bringing drinks and food and shifting my umbrella throughout the day to protect my from the sun. Beautiful resort and tremendous staff.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: Magazinedude
Reviews.Content: There are so many properties to choose while staying here in the Riviera Maya. This one is great but there are only a few rooms that are Beachfront. So if your going for the Beach? So So The staff is wonderful. It is however a drive into town and you get the stuck in the resort feeling while staying here.

Reviews.Title: “My dream come true”
Reviews.Author: cbuckmaster
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riviera Mandarin Oriental for part of our honeymoon in May. The resort was absolutely stunning - out of a luxury hotel magazine!! Checkin we were greeted with a beverage/popsicle and shown our room layout on an ipad which was such an innovative idea. The room was incredible - so unique and modern however still incorporating a lot of natural elements. We loved the double rainforest showers and the private backyard. Staff was the best I've ever experienced - professional yet wanted to get to know you on a personal level - always to provide better service. The most incredible part of this trip was the food at Aguamarina - the absolute BEST MEXICAN food we've ever had - I am still dreaming of the tamales now that I am back home. Actually everything on the menu was to die for. This hotel sets the standard for all hotels around the world. I would come back in a heart beat if given the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to relax!”
Reviews.Author: familymom111
Reviews.Content: We traveled with our daughter and we loved the experience. The staff is very eager to please and did everything possible to make us feel welcome and comfortable. Both Hotel and restaurant/ bar service are outstanding (it may be, however, a little intrusive at times for American standards). On the first day of stay, our daughter got a personalized cookie and a Mexican doll which was delightful. The Hotel's construction is Eco-conscious ( narrow and long to disturb the least the native ecosystem) and so, transport from the beach to the apartments and to the lobby is done in golf carts. We didn't mind at all hopping in a cart and the service is very fast and efficient. Our room was amazing! Beautifully decorated, large, and included a private backyard, a private swirl pool outside in the garden, a living room and huge bathroom. Overall we had a wonderful time and memorable moments in this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stress-free luxury Mexican beach holiday.”
Reviews.Author: nommiho
Reviews.Content: I am single female executive who was looking for a stress-free luxury beach holiday that was a direct flight from Washington. The Mandarin Oriental Riviera Maya does not disappoint!!! This is a beautiful luxury resort property that has everything you would expect from the Mandarin Oriental in terms of style and service. Only a 3-hour direct flight from Washington Dulles and 30 minutes from Cancun Airport…I spent 7 days at here. This Mexican paradise was a safe and peaceful resort, with great beach/spa/restaurants, and had absolutely exceptional service. This resort exceeded my expectations in every way and provided me with a perfect luxury beach holiday. Here’s a quick summary: Accommodation: I spent a significant amount in what I would describe was my own personal slice of heaven. I stayed in one of the Beachfront Casitas that had a private terrace overlooking the beach, a roof deck with plunge pool, and its own bit of beachfront. Interior design was stylish with a modern decor. My room was spacious and had a beautiful bathroom overlooking a secluded garden. One of the things I loved about the resort was way the property was laid out and provided privacy for those who want it or common guest areas for those looking to be around people. Service: The most impressive part of the resort is the unparalleled service and renowned attention to detail. I didn’t want for anything – the staff were always polite, helpful and extremely attentive. Since I was traveling alone, I would also like to mention that I found that the property to be incredibly safe. The hotel arranged for transportation to/from the airport and I never had to worry about anything. Dining: The food is of a very high standard. There are a variety of restaurants and bars that serve an eclectic selection of contemporary cuisine. Ambar is the much-touted signature restaurant, and Aguamarina is a lounge-like Mexican restaurant with a terrace and ocean views. One of my favorites was the beachfront/pool area restaurant - Ceviche Cha Cha. Whether you’re by the pool or on the beach, you can have some of the best sushi/ ceviche. But if you’re in the mood for something more substantial, the broiled fish sandwich or Kobe beef burger were fabulous along with chips, salsa & guacamole. Finally, if you’re not inclined to leave your room - in-room dining was also an excellent choice. My terrace over looked the beach and was a lovely place to have a pre-dinner cocktail/snack or breakfast in the morning. For breakfast - I highly recommend the homemade yoghurt with fresh fruit. Spa: The Spa/gym is definitely worth a visit. The gym is very nicely equipped, airy, and inspires you to work out even on vacation. The spa itself is beautiful with separate massage rooms. I tried the deep tissue massage to which was a great way to spend time on one afternoon when it was a bit cloudy. But I also recommend trying the other amenities like the vitality pool and the large mosaic humidity/steam room called a "hamam." Absolute heaven!!! Summary: The Mandarin was a true paradise and provided me with a perfect luxury beach holiday. The resort is ideal for singles, couples or families...and you could easily stay for a week without leaving its confines of the resort. Which is precisely what I did. I never needed to... or wanted to leave the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed by subpar wedding service!”
Reviews.Author: maisonpipi
Reviews.Content: I feel responsible to share my experience with anyone else who is considering choosing the Mandarin Oriental Riviera Maya as a wedding venue. To be fair, if this review was based on the site visit alone, it would have been great. The ambiance is private and refreshing, incredible food, and friendly service of the staff. Along with Rosewood Mayakoba, it is one of the best resorts in the region from a design perspective. All signs indicate that you’ll be treated well if you’re just vacationing. But if you’re planning a wedding, be prepared for overturned agreements, slow responses, and treatment like you’re intruders of the hotel, and you’ll need to be accommodating the hotel, not vice versa. And this is the subpar service we get, with our commitment to five star prices and room block requirement of 40 nights for 40 guests. Our experiences at the Mandarin in New York, San Francisco, and Hong Kong Landmark, had all been excellent (service, food, and design-driven spaces were a winning combination), so we’re excited to visit the MO in Riviera Maya in early February, thinking that its natural, chic ambiance and beach location will be perfect for our beach wedding (compared to the more traditional luxury at the Four Seasons and Ritz in Maui, and Four Seasons Biltmore in California). Our two-day visit at the resort had been pleasant and relaxing. Our hosts of the visit, the wedding advisor Roxana and Maurizio had been friendly, laid-back, and agreed to many of our requests with ease. We came back happy with our choices (including two other resorts we had visited), but had to wait a week for the diagnostic report of an important family member who is ill, before deciding. In the meantime, we had started asking questions we had on the contract, but all responses were made by the sales director, rather than Roxana and Maurizio, whom we had been in contact with. This was fine, thinking that maybe this is so because we’re discussing the contract. But we noticed that each response came back much slower than before, the longest being 9 days, excluding the week when she asked us to wait while she went on a trip. It was fine at first, thinking that she might be busier or it might just be the beach culture, but after a month we’re still not signed and still waiting, it started to feel like irresponsibility and disinterest. Even during our family member’s illness, we’re quicker to respond than she was. This is not the way to treat a client who is ready to sign. At this time, the worst came. After waiting for 9 days, we emailed her to touch base, only to get the response that expressed her apology, for ceremonies on the beach cannot start earlier than 5pm, and cocktail reception must begin after 6pm, according to hotel regulations. This is the first time she mentioned these timing, after Roxana agreed during our site visit that ceremony starts at 4:30pm (written on the proposed contract). And this is after I told her that the sunset time in the region on our date of choice (in November) is estimated to be 5:07 PM, and so we requested to change the ceremony to 4pm. How can any hotel ask their wedding guests to start the ceremony 7 minutes before sunset, let alone a 5-star hotel?? Even if the kind Roxana had made a mistake by agreeing to 4:30pm, the hotel should have corrected it immediately after, but not wait 4 weeks! Regardless, the hotel should have honored the agreement, because the employees represented the hotel, and we should have been able to trust them. We visited the venue to discuss such details and get a feel of the service level, so it should have been a honest reflection for services to come. Through my own research and experience of my friends, a beach wedding should typically start about 1.5 hours before estimated sunset, to account for any delays, and allow for enough time and lighting for the photo session after. Many beach resorts provide sunset information to the guests and advise wedding guests to schedule their agenda around this. But not the Mandarin, they’re working as though they had never hosted a wedding in November. And they are completely ignorant of the wedding guests’ schedule and experience. We decided to email the sales director again, expressing our thoughts politely, hoping to give the project one last try. This time she told me that she went and pleaded to the general manager, but in order to start the ceremony at 4:30, they must set up the ceremony on the left end of the beach. Another agreement she’s trying to overturn! During our site-visit, we noticed how narrow the beach was in front of the Mandarin. So we immediately asked Roxana if we could set up our ceremony as far to the right as possible (where the beach is wider), away from the pier on the left end (because we wanted a clean backdrop) and away from the sunbathers, and she pleasantly agreed. She only told us, but not too close to the beachfront carsitas (villas located on the further right side of the beach). This is understandable, especially after we read the complaint on this site about weddings being too noisy for the carsita occupants. Why did she need to “plead” to the general manager to allow a wedding ceremony to start just 30 minutes before sunset? Why does the sales director have to “plead” to honor a previous agreement, to help a wedding run smoothly? Whatever happened to the five-star service that they promised on the wedding brochure? Each standard request we had seemed to be an uphill climb. Despite the prices that we’re paying, we’re treated like intruders to the other guests. Yes, the beach is small, something that the hotel is familiar with. How can they provide wedding services if they cannot accommodate wedding parties and hotel guests at the same time? With respect to other guests, the location we requested was the unused space on the beach between the carsita front and the sunbathing lounges. But the sales director had the nerve to ask us to be responsible for any complaints they may encounter, and she warned that the price is large. The hotel isn’t even fit to advertize wedding services if they actually think this way! It’s their responsibility to accommodate both, and we shouldn’t be treated like intruders! This is unacceptable, and not the kind of service that the Mandarin is known for. We decided to make one last attempt to “accommodate” the hotel. We offered to rent the beachfront carsita, in order to set up the ceremony in front of the carsita 1.5 hour before sunset, without disrupting other guests. $3800+ to rent the carsita for two nights, was the price we’re willing to pay to buy time. My friend joked that I make a better employee for the hotel, because I came up with proposals to encourage sales and I'm loyal, not to mention that we’re paying too. As a designer I’m a total softie for simple, clean design. We had already fallen in love with the beautiful venue, and the quality of the food there was hard to overcome too, kudos to the talented chefs. And not to mention the daunting task of restarting our search, as our second favorite venue had been booked by now. With our newest proposal the sales director agreed to the location, of course, but still insisted on starting the ceremony at 4:30, leaving only 30 minutes before sunset! So I think it’s time to give up. I feel responsible to share our horrible experience with other couples planning a wedding, and hopefully make it known to the upper management of the Mandarin Oriental, as this is not the kind of service it is known for, and not the way to run an otherwise great resort.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED the service, spa and rooms”
Reviews.Author: LovingLondongirl
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to say that we had the most AMAZING trip ever to Mandarin Oriental. The staff are incredible - especially Luis and Collio - my husband said he enjoyed our stay there even more than our honeymoon. We have been lucky enough to stay in a lot of five-star hotels across the world, and we really think this is the best. Total luxury with amazing rooms, cocktails and service - what more could anyone want?!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service and superb resort”
Reviews.Author: Newyorker12345
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic three days with our 3 year old son. The staff were amazing, always ready to offer assistance in any way, and exceptionally kind to our son - ey even cut a coconut from the tree just for him, and left little presents like a decorated cookie in the room for him. The room was enormous and the bathroom with double showers was very modern. I think that the food was of an extremely high standard. Certainly expensive, but also creative and interesting. The beach was perfect and much nicer than at the other hotels on the same stretch (Rosewood and Fairmont) because the Mandarin has a pool on an upper level, and so the guests are not all crowded into one place. I cannot recommend the place highly enough and will definitely return. I have seen a few mixed reviews on this site and really think that they seem incongruous with e great experience that we had

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular !”
Reviews.Author: MOWedding
Reviews.Content: Want to have a wedding of a life time? Well, we did! When it came to picking a place for our wedding, very private I must ad (just the two of us),there was no question in our minds what we wanted, but the big question was who can deliver. Not getting into our travels, let’s just say we have a few miles under our belts worldwide and we like good service. With that said, we had the pleasure to enjoy the MO In NYC the service goes without saying the best! But a wedding in Mexico? Yes, a big YES! Never in our lives have we been cared for in the way that staff of the MO care for our needs and our very important day in our lives. I can’t say enough good things about this property, from the grounds to the food, spa, beach ……..you name it. I was impressed and I don’t what to sound pampas, but I don’t get Impressed easy (the Groom), especially when it comes to service, I loved it! I can go on forever about the MO but if you are a guy like me over worked and you don’t want to blow the only time you have in some place where you’re going to have to share a table with a stranger and you’re wondering about the MO Wonder no more! This is that place to go!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience!”
Reviews.Author: WOXC
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Mandarin Oriental Riviera Maya! Excellent service, excellent property, excellent food = excellent vacation!

Reviews.Title: “I found Paradise”
Reviews.Author: YasminNorman
Reviews.Content: I have had a busy stressful year and was looking for a place where I could enjoy of the Ocean the breeze and lots of pampering and I found Mandarin Oriental. The first class transportation was ready for me as I exited the airport doors with a smile and genuine friendliness. Once I arrived at the hotel, I was welcomed by my butler and other members of the staff with warmth and my choice of drink :) the paperwork was done extremely fast while I was sitting down, sipping my delicious drink, after that I was given a tour in a go cart of the whole place. Mi suite was impeccable, the decor was simple but classy with a touch of oriental feel and the view was breathtaking, as I opened the sliding door, the sound of waves breaking in the shore, the breeze in my face I knew I had found Paradise... Did I mention I had my private entrance to the beach and a pool on the rooftop of my suite? simply gorgeous. But Mandarin Oriental is much more than just luxury, its also great service. The spa was beautiful, relaxing and the massages were just wonderful. The restaurants had the freshest first class food (try their ceviche, their steaks, their desserts, heck try everything!) The staff made sure my tour and itinerary of the nearby attractions, shopping and sightseeing fitted my needs and wants. by the way, the tour guide they recommended was incredible; very friendly and knowledgeable with a great sense of humor. Needless to say, I left this wonderful place with only one regret: not spending enough time there as six days were not long enough to experience this piece of heaven on earth.

Reviews.Title: “Simply THE BEST!”
Reviews.Author: nyc1972
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Mandarin Oriental Riviera Maya with my wife and I can't say enough great things about this resort. First of all, the property is gorgeous and the rooms were fantastic. We've stayed at several places in the Riviera Maya and the rooms at the Mandarin blow them all out of the water! The service was hands-down the best we've ever had. Everyone there was so attentive without being intrusive. The food at both restaurants was phenomenal. And the spa was the nicest spa either one of us had ever been to. So what more can I say? The resort is paradise and we can't wait to go back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous place, great food, lovely staff - it was paradise”
Reviews.Author: jenz63
Reviews.Content: The amenities were amazing. The rooms were large, comfortable and beautiful. The food at both the pool and Ambar was delicious. Overall the place was amazing. We truly loved it there and can't wait to go back. The place is small enough that the staff provides personal service. You can't go wrong with this one! There is also outdoor sculptural art all around the grounds.

Reviews.Title: “It doesn't get better than this!!!”
Reviews.Author: bigbrowndog3
Reviews.Content: Our son was married at the Mandarin Oriental last weekend and every moment of our time at the hotel exceeded our highest expectations. There were 120 guests attending the events and each & every one of the them were treated like they were the only person at the resort....the staff just couldn't do enough. The rooms were so spacious, well appointed (2 showers!!!) and clean....each had a private outdoor area and the beds were just yummy!!!! The food was outstanding....family and friends commented that it was, without question, simply the best. The spa was exceptional....the services top of the line. Beach & pools were phenomenal. The question now is " how soon can we go back?"

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: BentheH
Reviews.Content: We wanted to have see views (difficult in Playa believe it or not). We went for the most expansive option: the casitas on the beach. Only 6 of them. Room was good but what a noise! We could hear our neighbor speak as isolation between casitas is awfull. On top there was wedding on the beach. Good for them but we came for to rest and got loud music until 3 in the morning. We were off season which mean only one restaurant to choose from. Not worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found! Exquisite hotel with impeccable service.”
Reviews.Author: abbygailnyc
Reviews.Content: We are two fairly high-strung New York professionals who have passports struggling to make room for new stamps, and we felt like we walked into heaven on earth. Shangri-la. Paradise. We were greeted at the palatial reception area on a very hot and humid day to be greeted by a half dozen fresh squeezed chilled juices and homemade pineapple/mango popsicles. The staff was warm and welcoming. We were delighted with the comfort and beauty of our room. It was spacious and had a completely private outdoor area with a dining set, two cushioned beach chairs, and a private outdoor bath/dipping pool. We had a lovely view of a cenote - out of which iguanas, tropical birds and the most beautiful butterflies would make daily appearances. I cannot express how helpful, courteous and accomodating the staff was. Beyond coming home each evening to different surprises in the room - a selection of stuffed peppers, margaritas waiting only for ice in a shaker, a bottle of scotch, a selection of chocolates, fresh fruit. The spa was gorgeous and super-luxury. I have never been is a steam room that gorgeous and the vitality pool was amazing. Each night at the spa, the attendant created a 1 on 1 routine for me, depending on how much time I had. The servers at the pool/beach remembered our names and each hour or so would bring us different snacks and drinks to try. They perfected the balance of always being there when we wanted them to be, but never being overbearing or intrusive. The service extended way beyond that though - we took a day trip to Tulum and on returning, were stopped by a corrupt policeman who took our IDs and demanded a bribe before he would return them. He said he would wait outside the hotel for us. Upon going to the front desk to get the money for the bribe, the head of the reception area who asked me what was wrong got the head of security and they both came with us to find the policeman. We couldn't find him and gave up on getting our driver's license back. A half hour later, the two Mandarin Oriental staffers had tracked down the man and gotten back our IDs and brought it to the room. The food is expensive, but it is world-class. Also, the portions are enormous! We never ate our own entrees except at breakfast. We split 3 appetizers for dinner at Ambar and were stuffed. Plus, it was exceptional food and they treated us like gold! We checked in 4 days after the previous reviewer, Kamala76. The roof of the restaurant at the beach/pool had been repaired. I can't recommend this place enough!

Reviews.Title: “A real disappointment---Please read it before going!!”
Reviews.Author: kamala76
Reviews.Content: I have been using Trip advisor for most of my travels. I travel 20 days a month abroad my country for business and I normally stay in very high-end properties, from Four Season to Ritz Carlton to Peninsula hotel as well as One and Only resorts.I never wrote on trip advisor but this time I feel forced to do it. People must know what is going on at the resort. We arrived at the hotel on the 14th of August and we were so excited because I have been staying in other Mandarin Oriental hotels and I was sure that this was going to be superb. The resort is a long stretch from the main road to the beach. Is very narrow and long. When we arrived, check in was very smooth and quite fast. Got upgraded because the stay was book thru my AMEX Centurion card travel service. Staff was very nice and friendly which is the only good thing about the resort. Everybody do theirs best to make things nice, even if at the end everything makes this effort vane. We arrived to the room which was quite nice with a beutiful bathroom and a view over a sort of pond. Till now impression was very good and we were still very excited. All the excitment ended when we reached the beach. The hotel is falling apart. Everywhere you see any metal you will find rust and pieces missing. The beach has a restaurant which few days ago lost part of the ceiling and even if I told staff about it no one would do anything to repair it. Another part of the roof is going to fall soon as well but this time will probably hit someones head because is just over the deck where you can have breakfest and lunch. All wooden floors are scratched and bad conditions. The beach which is an average one is only cleaned once a day around 9.00 o clock am. Now this would be ok if it wasn't that it rains many times a day and the sea during the storm brings along with the rain a lot of junk which stays there till the next day. The resort has a sort of wooden bridge that streaches out for 50-60 meters in the sea. Well one year ago a heavy storm made this bridge dangerous. Instead of repairing it they have decided to put a plastic ribbon at the entrance with the words DANGEROUS. Now, if you by any chance have a child you must make sure that he do not get near it or probably he will get hurt as well as any adult which is not carefull. A child can get hurt 100 times in 1 day if not carefull because all over you look everything is breaking down. I have spoke to many managers because the Director of the hotel was on holidays and they all were very sorry about it and they said that sooner or later these things were going to be fixed. After a few days I learn that due to the econimic crise, the resort which is half owned by private Mexincans and the other half owned by Mandarin, have decided not to fix it. I have learned that many people at the resort have complained but nothing has been done. I have taken pictures of what I'm talking about because I dont want anyone from the resort to say that this is all a lie. Most of the sun beds were broken and left on the beach with no repair. The resort has no maintenance at all!!! Most of the days it rained and lot of water go into the room. If you flush the toilet you will not be able to use the shower or the sink because there is no enough water due to the fact that they have used small pipes. I have learned that when the resort first opened everyday they had lots of issues with the water in the bathroom. The resort has 2 main restaurants for dinner which are very good. Food is fresh and very tasty but the menu are very limited which would not be a problem if they both were opened all days. We had to eat twice in the room at dinner because the restaurant that we liked closed for 2 nights and we didn't feel like eating what the other one was offering. I wonder how a resort which is very far away form everything can allow 1 of the restaurants to close. Again lots of guest were complaining also of this. As many resorts, transportation is taken care by golf carts. Every time that you need 1, you just need to call the front desk and they will send one. Well this sounds absolutely normal if it's wasnt the fact that you had to wait up to 15 min for them to pick you up. The reason is that because we were not many guest they only had 1 golf cart which was working. If you are a person on a wheelchair DONT GO!!!! They have not thought about you and the problem this could cause. You will not be able to go to the pool or to the restaurant at the beach for dinner unless you think is ok that someone has to carry you up the stairs. I could go on and on about what was not working, so many things are not working that makes you crazy. I do not have any personal reason to write this bad review but if someone else wrote this when I had to decide where to stay I would have been very greatful. ALL THE THINGS THAT I'M MENTIONING ARE ON MY PICTURES!! Next to the resort there is a Banyan Tree resort which looks very good and it seems that they care much more about details. The only 2 things that I want to mention which have been great are the staff, always smiling and professional and the diving center which is well organized and with very good instructors. If you are used to FOUR SEASON resorts or ONE AND ONLY resorts or any very high end property dont go to this one. You will be disappointed. For what i concerns the cost of extras I would say that they are ok except for the cost of the tours which are incredibly expensive. I wanted to go to Chichen Itza with the hotel car and they asked around 675 USD plus taxes or hotel transfer from and to the airport for 275 USD plus taxes. I rented a car and drove to Playa del Carmen and Tulum as well as Cancun. Driving is so easy because is all one 1 straight road. You cannot make any mistake but if you don't feel like driving because afraid of the way they drive just ask for a taxi. Very safe and nice. Internet is 25 USD a day plus tax. I wonder how in a resort like this they can still ask to be paid for the WIFI after all the money you give them for the stay. If you need private transportation just go on the official web site of Cancun airport and they sell private and very serious transportation with SUV and private driver for 110 USD round trip. I wrote a letter also to the Mandarin Headquarter but till now no answer, maybe they think that i was saying a bunch of lies in order to get something back but I hope that they will soon send someone over there to see as well what is going on. Again, I never wrote any review about any resort or hotel I have been to, but this time I really wanted people to get the picture of how it is. THIS IS THE TRUTH!! Anybody which will tell you the opposite is telling you a lie.

Reviews.Title: “The most amazing resort we have visited”
Reviews.Author: bmackdc
Reviews.Content: Our trip to the Mandarin Oriental Riviera Maya exceeded all expectations. The facility is absolutely beautiful. The staff are warm and welcoming. They provided the highest possible level of guest service. The suite was amazing clean and well appointed. The spa was absolutely breathtaking. The appointed guide for our Chichen Itza excursion was incredibly well versed in Mayan history and culture. She provided great insight into our trip making it a much deeper experience. I would recommend this facility to anyone looking for a comfortable, luxurious, relaxing resort in Mexico. Bravo Mandarin Oriental. Bravo.

Reviews.Title: “Is there any other”
Reviews.Author: SummerC_71
Reviews.Content: The place is simply the best in general I can’t tell you what I like more, the sceneries, the beach, the comfort of the rooms, the service. If a have to say something negative of the place it will be the distances from any were.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel made me want to write on Trip advisor for the first time”
Reviews.Author: go2728
Reviews.Content: - The only positive of this stay was the us$ 1000 room we stayed in, as the room is very well decorated with state of the art facilities - the location of the hotel has to be questioned. it advertises the fact that its based near 'cenotes' and that makes it popular. BUT they have constructed two filthy lakes which are meant to have crocodiles but only breed mosquitos. We could not stay or relax outside after 4pm because mosquitos would attack us. We have travelled around the world in mosquito sensitive parts of the world but this by far is the worse and the hotel deserves full blame for this. On top of that unlike other luxury hotels based in mosquito infested areas the hotel did not provide us with any repellents etc - staff nice but efficiency very poor: they had to pick us up to the room to bring us to the restaurant/reception as the hotel is quite long - waiting time was long and at times we were left to wait outside for more than 20mins. - food was good, very expensive, which was fine as the quality was one of the best in that part of town - Nightlife was fun at playa del carmen was good. Now to go into some major details which i can assure has convinced me never to stay at a mandarin oriental hotel despite being a big fan of all their city hotels - Concierge, She failed to recommend a single decent restaurant we could dine at. We were visiting during new years time and she sent us to a restaurant with 50 tables the first night and zero people dinning. We asked for a rental car to be arranged. We were told at 10pm the car will be there at 7am. We planned our whole day and the hotel failed to give us any update till 10am and than we were told the car was NEVER arranged. Concierge gave us completely wrong cab fares and all cabs were willing to charge half the price we were told and that didn't involve in bargaining. We eventually gave up and arranged all booking through a local taxi driver and internet - Bill. We were double charged for our bill and after this dreadful experience it took us 2 months to receive a refund where the hotel was convinced we weren't double charged and we had to send them proof 2 times. - We had to ask for our taxi to the hotel to be booked 3 times as front desk kept forgetting about it - Yoga classes were fun but regardless of the level they say all levels were similar so i highly recommend not doing them as a beginner. All in all i would say mandarin oriental has tarnished their reputation in hotel management by opening this hotel. Once again, they have years of experience in hotel management and i hope this is read by the right people so they can take the necessary steps to improve this specific hotel before they lose more fans.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Excellence”
Reviews.Author: jamsy1
Reviews.Content: I am a Travel Agent, I have travelled the world, the service we received was second to none. I cant think of a hotel where the attention to detail and service was better. The resort is beautiful, and unique in so many ways, but the service by every single member of staff was outstanding. Trust me we really looked around we had 6 days in an all inclusive prior to checking in and checked out and the 5 days we stayed at the MandarinOriental really made our holiday one to be remembered. we shall definitely be recommending this place to many people and going back

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort, but...”
Reviews.Author: travel141
Reviews.Content: There is a lot to love about this resort. Gorgeous & well-appointed suites, beautiful stretch of beach, and a staff that really goes the extra mile. Our issue was that the hotel is marketed as being kid-friendly, and in our experience it just wasn't. I see some reviews here suggesting otherwise, but I really felt like this was a couples hotel above all else. When we were there, my 4-year old daughter was one of TWO kids at the entire resort. (And we rarely saw the other child) The suites do not have a separate bedroom which is not great for families. The kids center was very small (though the staff was wonderful). And the bathtub has to be started by the hotel staff (who wants to wait 20 minutes for a staff member just to give their kid a 10-minute bath?) which was really bizarre. The hotel is gorgeous and the staff did the best they could to accommodate us, but so many things just weren't kid-friendly. That's perfectly fine, but then they need to change the way they market themselves. In my opinion, Four Seasons sets the standard when it comes to creating an upscale atmosphere that caters to EVERYONE, including children. I suspect that is what Mandarin Oriental is going for here, but they really missed the mark. I would consider returning to this hotel for a romantic vacation with my husband, but we won't be going back with our daughter. (Though I have to say that the location is not nearly as picturesque as other parts of Mexico, particularly the Pacific coast)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property. Gorgeous beaches. Great food.”
Reviews.Author: charlestonpanic
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the MO for pure relaxation. Our daughter is 5 years old and was excited about the kids club. The website specifically "At Mandarin Oriental Riviera Maya all the family will be able to enjoy a holiday. Our Little Fans Club provides stimulating entertainment, with imaginatively thought out creative activities and games, keeping young children occupied throughout the day." Their site also goes on to state: "Please advise us of the age of your children and we will be delighted to organize a welcome pack for them and ensure appropriate sized robes and slippers in the room." We booked our room through American Express Centurion. Our confirmation information that had MO cc'd on it specifically stated we had a 5 year old and would need a roll away bed. We arrived late and room was not set up this way. The resort did immediately remedy even providing a cute doll for our daughter. The next morning we went to the kids club. It was closed. We kept asking staff about it and after about an hour or so of waiting a manager came to say it was closed because the girl who worked it needed the day off. After noticing our frustration and my repeated request that this was acceptable, the hotel clearly understood and our butler ended up staying with our daughter and even going out on the beach to fly a kite. We would have been fine watching our daughter, however after many visits to resorts with kids club she loves them and gets very excited about attending. Once she saw the room with all the toys, arts and crafts, video games, etc it was hard for her not to want to play. I would have expected the hotel to have been on top of both of these items due to the expensive rack rate and nature of this type of hotel. When paying 5 star prices I expect 5 star service. They did remedy, however both times after our daughters disappointment. The girl would worked the kids club showed up the next day and was fantastic and the rest of the stay worked perfectly. We had a beachfront casita with rooftop pool. The pool was freezing. There was no way you could swim in it. Further, our pool lights did not work which really were needed if you were to enjoy the roof top at night. We requested this to be fixed on 3 occasions and it never was attended to our knowledge. It never did work and we were never told that it was out of service for good due to a larger problem. The room was great. Layout very nice. View was amazing. My husband and I wonder if this was a hotel that the MO came in and renovated. For being only a few years old it seemed pretty dates. Lots of rust spots on the outside, tile nicked or cracked in spots, etc. I am curious if we are correct. The beach here is gorgeous and we had beach chairs right in front that they set up daily with towels. The pool was also very nice and the staff very attentive. I went to the spa for a massage. Very nice. We also used the gym and it was very nice as well. Very spacious with nice cardio and weight machines. Also, there is a nice area with a few mats for stretching, etc. The food was great at both the poolside restaurant and room service. It was right on time and staff very accomodating. I did not find the prices to be too high given the nature of this type of hotel. We did not find the conceirge to be overly helpful. If you want to do anything off the property they recommend tour companies. We wanted to go snorkeling in Alkumel with the help of a taxi and I figured this out using TA, not the hotel. They really were not very helpful in this regard. Finally, they gave us a bill to check the morning of our departure. It all looked fine and I called the front desk to let them know. When we went to leave they handed me an envelope with the final copy. We were in a hurry to get to the airport and I did not look at it until we were in the car to go. They had put on the final bill about an additional $200 worth of honor bar charges. I do not think this was accurate, however by the time we finally got home it was water under the bridge and really was such a small amount in comparison to our overall trip. More frustrated that I felt taken advantage since they didn't point out that it was different than the one I had approved. If we would return to this area I would stay at this hotel if they were offering a discounted rate. We did get one night free b/c we booked x amount (can't remember now what the number was). The rack rate seems high, however it is a gorgeous private beachfront location. I think we would try either the Banyan Tree Mayakoba, Grand Velas, or the Rosewood Mayakoba. I would still recommend to a friend telling them the above. The beach here is truly gorgeous and not crowded at all!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: henrygelb
Reviews.Content: From the moment you step into the lobby of this resort, you already feel relaxed. Everything exceeded expectations, from the room to the staff. Food was excellent, the beach was pristine. If I return to this area in the future, this will definitely be my resort of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Seclusion, Privacy and Unbridled Luxury on the Riviera Maya”
Reviews.Author: LuvLuxury003
Reviews.Content: First off let me say that I travel frequently and have stayed in many of the worlds best hotels from Asia to Europe and this is the first time I have taken the time to write a review. My girlfriend and I stayed at the MO Riviera Maya for a week at the beginning of May. It was our first vacation together and I really wanted it to go well. The MO helped make it a very special stay which neither of us will forget! We were met at the airport by he hotel driver and taken to the hotel in an Escalade - the water and cold towels in the car were very welcome. Check in was a breeze. We were offered several kinds of cool fruit juices as the receptionist took down all our preferences and gave us an orientation of the hotel. We were then whisked off to our Beachfront Casita. I have to say that these are not cheap rooms but they are entirely worth the expense. The room was huge and literally steps from the beach with a deck overlooking the beach. Large palm fronds in front of the deck ensured privacy from the beach while still giving us a great view of the blue blue ocean. The bathroom had a really large tub fro two, a separate two person walk-in shower and a large changing area also for two. However, the really great thing was the rooftop infinity pool overlooking the ocean with our own sun beds and loungers which were made up with towels and pillows every day. The beach was about 15 feet from our room. Beachfront casitas come with their own specific beach loungers. These were made up for us every morning before we arrived and strategically set between two large coconut trees on the beach in front of our room. The beachside staff were great. Every time I waved, someone would literally run over to get our order and they were always moving the umbrellas to make sure we had shade when we wanted it (I would like to make special mention of our beachside servers Edgar, Jose Luis, Catalino and Wilfred but they were all great). The food at the beach bar was good - ceviche and sushi rolls. Drinks were better - the Mandarin Sidecar being our favorite. The hotel was definitely not at full occupancy so we pretty much had the beach and pool areas to ourselves which suited us fine. Every morning we would order breakfast, then go for a swim in the ocean and by the time we were back, breakfast was set up for us on the deck. We spent most of our days on the pristine beach. Two afternoons we took a snorkeling trip and a scuba diving trip to some really pretty reefs (apparently the reef off the Riviera Maya is the worlds second longest coral reef after the Great Barrier Reef in Australia). We also took a trip to Tulum which was great - go in the morning because they close at 4pm and they have a great beach. We also had spa treatments on our last day and I wish I had done that on our first day. The spa facilities were excellent and we could have spent much longer there. In the evenings, we either ordered room service (which was good but limited) and ate out on the deck or went to the Ambar restaurant. A special note on Ambar. I am somewhat of a foodie and to be honest, I wasn't expecting much from the food at a resort. Ambar totally proved me wrong. The food was inventive, flavorful and perfectly cooked. Now this may be because we also had the restaurant pretty much to ourselves on the nights we were there but again that suited us fine. It was then great to come back to the room, go up onto the roof and watch the stars from the infinity pool. We slept like babies to the sound of the waves. All in all I had a thoroughly relaxing and luxurious stay at the Mandarin Oriental and I would definitely go back (and I would definitely get the Beachfront Casita again). Its a very expensive place to go but if you want to be pampered in a world class resort this is definitely a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: USTraveller123
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel. Of the high-end places I've stayed in the area, I'd rate it better than the Ritz Carlton, and at the same level as the Banyan Tree and LeBlanc. Actually the service at the Mandarin was the best of the group. We stayed in a Selva Suite. I liked the room a lot. It was private, well-designed, and comfortable. The room blended in well with the "jungle" outside, and included both warm and cold dip pools. The service was among the best I've encountered anywhere -- reception, concierge, the people in the restaurants and bars, the people who cleaned the rooms, they were all good. Management did a good job of selecting and training staff. I've generally found hotel butlers useless and annoying. That wasn't the case at all here -- Rodrigo's suggestions as to things to do were actually worthwhile and not just an attempt to sell hotel services, and he saved us a good bit of time dealing with administrative matters. Special mention also goes to security and to the honesty of the staff. The hotel made the mistake of leaving a complimentary bottle of champagne in our room one evening, and both my girlfriend and I ended up leaving pretty lit. She left 15,000 pesos in her bathrobe, and I left the safety deposit box open. When we returned, security had cordoned off our room, because the night maid had noticed that the box was open. Nothing was missing from it when we returned. The bathrobe had ended up at the hotel laundry, where security found every single peso. I liked the set up of the beach and the pool and the facilities around them better than other hotels I've stayed at in the area. It was nice not having to deal with crowds, which has been a problem on occasion at the Ritz and Palace resorts. It was semi low season when we visited though (Memorial Day weekend in U.S.) The fitness center was good. Wireless internet in the room worked well. The place is very spread out. This has its pluses and minuses. If you want to ride the elevator and 5 minutes later be at the pool or beach or restaurant, this isn't the place for you. If you like to walk or if you don't mind waiting on the carts and enjoy having some privacy in a habitation that blends in with nature, then you'll probably like the place. Realize that it is hot and humid parts of the year, which may make a difference in how much you're going to enjoy walking. But, again, there are the electric carts. The one item that needs improvement is the food, the quality and price. I've paid for overpriced, above-average food at other high end hotels in Mexican resorts. The problem at the Mandarin Oriental, the food wasn't above-average, and the price was as high or higher than restaurants in comparable hotels. Another reviewer suggested renting a car, to be able to go to restaurants in Playa del Carmen and see the sites. I'd agree with that, although I can't recall having a truly memorable meal at any restaurant in Playa del Carmen. Maybe I'm just picky. I would recommend you try the restaurant at the Banyan Tree next door, in particular if you like oriental food. The Tom Yum Goong there was the best I've had anywhere. A couple of other items, if management ever reads this -- as others have pointed out here, providing bicycles to people who want them, like the Banyan Tree, would be a good idea. Also, given that there's no business center yet, adding a printer to the public computer would be a good idea.

Reviews.Title: “Ah, wonderful Mexico!”
Reviews.Author: Tripreviewergirl
Reviews.Content: This is our forth time back to the Riviara Maya area. Having stayed in the Fairmont Mayakoba, Banyon Tree and Maroma, we were anxious to check out something new. While I must admit that I was not in love with the decor or ambiance of the MO (sort of South Beach meets Fred Flintstone--very white with big rocks all over the place), our room was stunning. Also, the layout of the hotel doesn't make a lot of sense to me--the lobby is virtually DESERTED save for the wonderful staff. The beach, quite a distance from everything, had two restaurants--one being very "basement like" and somewhat depressing. Food, however, was wonderful! Unlike the Fairmont and Banyon Tree, bikes were not available so one had to rely on the staff to bring to to the lobby/beach/gym/room via golf cart. They were very responsive, but it was a little annoying. As it was the beginning of "off season" and the end of a horrific economic cycle, the hotel was EMPTY and lacked that nice vacation vibe. We were the only two soles even in the beautiful bar for a pre-dinner cocktail! While I would return to the area in a heartbeat, I'd wait to see a real "deal" to go back to the MO. Loved it but love the Banyon Tree more...

Reviews.Title: “mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: ecran56003
Reviews.Content: we just spent 4 days at the Mandarin Oriental Riviera Maya. the facilities are outstanding as you would expect from the chain (although a fresh coat of paint is in need in some parts of the hotel). staff was very friendly and helpful (i got sick and they did their best to provide support including the GM). unfortunately there are only 2 restaurants open (one for lunch the other for dinner) and both their menus are quite limited. hence the need to take a taxi to to the city for dinner for diversity purpose. also the excursions proposed by the hotel (along with the spa) are totally overpriced.Overall we felt it was on the expensive side for what we got.

Reviews.Title: “Magical Mayan Riveria Holiday”
Reviews.Author: anneree
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a seven day stay at the Mandarin Oriental on the Riveria Maya. It was magical in everyway possible. The staff was incredible - efficient, knowledgeable, smart, accomadating, caring, etc. Our pleasure was definitely their top priority. We felt pampered everyday. The location, our room, the lobby, the pool, the gardens, the spa, the gym were so breath-taking and picturesque. Their website doesn't capture the beauty of this resort. We would highly recommend this hotel. It was our best vacation yet...and we've travel quite a bit.

Reviews.Title: “The best”
Reviews.Author: chenchoMonterrey
Reviews.Content: I dont get many of the bad reviews,maybe they had issues before, but our stay was nothing short of spectacular. Check in was a breeze,the service for breakfast and the beach club was very good they went the extra mile every time,the golf carts were ready every time we asked for them,the only thing was the price but you should expect this at high-end resorts like this one,i will return as soon as i can. My kids loved the place they were treated like royalty.

Reviews.Title: “A staff who couldn't care less, and management that backs it up”
Reviews.Author: sharonvaughn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited the Mandarin Oriental in January of this year hoping to experience the true luxury and service promised by such a prestigious brand. The first part of our trip was to the Ritz Carlton in Cancun, where we were treated with personal service by a staff that truly cared about our satisfaction. After one day at the Mandarin, with people who ignored our every request, and management that tried to justify the staff's dismissive attitude by noting that it was simply our "perception" I wanted to burst in to tears and wished dearly that we had never left the Ritz Carlton. Being frequent travellers, we are very aware of the levels of service that can be expected throughout the world. The staff at the Mandarin Oriental Riviera Maya was outright rude, and could not meet simple requests for Housekeeping Service, Transportation, or general reservation requests. All of these things on their own would be less significant if they were not compounded by an acting manager who kept us waiting for at least 30 minutes on one day, and failed to show up to a meeting on the next. Although we expected a proactive response from the Corporate office upon our return home, it took 30 days of follow up emails and phone calls to get an answer, and in the end we were offered the opportunity to make another reservation at an equally overpriced rate during the low season. Please know our issues are not just our perception, but we spoke with several other guests during our trip who had very similar problems with the service and availability of the amenities at this resort. My warnings to fellow travellers are: - 16% service charge on top of all other rates and fees that is supposed to cover service that is terrible- totally unjustified - Be prepared to walk because it is very difficult to catch the promised golf cart to navigate the large resort - You can better count on the surrounding resorts to help you with transportation between the Mayakoba area. Mandarin promises an Escalade or similar but we were offered a small questionable taxi on more than one occassion. - The concierge is as useful about the surrounding area as Google. You may as well explore blindfolded as they have no recommendations outside their resort. - If you do plan on utilizing the outlets at the resort don't assume they will be open. Most were closed during our visit despite the high season. - Service in the beach and pool area is very limited and slow although the area is beautiful. We had better luck walking down the beach to a neighboring resort where we got great service, and staff rotated the area cleaning sunglasses, serving cold fruit, etc... Mandarin obviously doesn't feel the need to go above and beyond. The general attitude was of entitlement and lack of urgency. I highly recommend if you are staying in Riviera Maya choose a neighbor such as the Banyan Tree or Rosewood, or stay in Cancun at the Ritz Carlton, where they will really make you feel at home. Here is our letter to the company which received no appropriate response: "My husband and I have just returned to our Texas home after a very disturbing stay at your Riviera Maya property. We would greatly appreciate a personal conversation with yourself or someone at the appropriate level to address the very disconcerting experience we feel should be urgently addressed. Because it is fair that you have some background information prior to speaking with us I will give you a brief description of our concerns. Our initial impression was during a dinner we had at Ambar on Sunday, January 3rd. During our dinner we asked several times for information on room availability because we were so intrigued by the beauty of the resort. Unfortunately after several attempts to make a reservation on site we were told by the concierge on the way out to call the 800 # the next day. Since we are both in the hospitality business, we found it curious that our reservation wouldn't be handled on site, especially since we were offering our credit card right away to book a suite. Perhaps this should have been a warning to us. Rather than calling the 800# the next day we called the resort and requested to speak with a manager and received a call back from Mr. Fernando Gibaja. While we were enjoying a wonderful stay at the Ritz Carlton Cancun, where we normally stay, we expected an elevated level of service comparable to the incredible decor of the Riviera Maya resort, and in line with Mandarin Oriental's reputation. Mr. Gibaja was helpful in getting us a reservation for three nights (January 5 - 8, 2010) and transporting us from the Ritz Carlton. We felt that Mr. Gibaja handled our call gracefully and we were excited to experience your resort. Unfortunately we never heard from Mr. Gibaja again, and learned during our stay that the General Manager (Patrick Dennis Finnet) was no longer employed at the resort. Perhaps the breakdown in management contributed to the many breakdowns in service we experienced. Unfortunately that does not excuse them. Upon our arrival on Tuesday, the 5th, our excitement was quickly squashed. After experiencing several distressing service issues each day we requested to speak with a manager only to be pacified or ignored by front line staff members. On our final day we spoke with the Assistant General, "Fred", who never followed up with us or addressed any of our issues. Some of the issues included being ignored by staff, no service in the restaurants or pool area, incomplete housekeeping services, not being offered any information about the resort's outlets, etc... When Fred did speak with us, very briefly, we were told that our issues were simply our "perception" of the resort. In addition, he made the assumption that we had a problem at the Ritz Carlton, which could not be further from the truth. In fact, we were sad to be at the Mandarin, where we were ignored, not greeted, and dismissed when requesting help rather than spending our last few days with the warm, caring, willing and attentive staff at the Ritz Carlton. While the resort is stunningly beautiful and the room product beyond compare, the staff attitude, carelessness, and dismissiveness of the management was certainly not in line with what earned this property it's 5 diamonds; nor was it in keeping with Mandarin Oriental service expectations. I can assure you it was not "gracious and sincere and steeped in the values of the orient" as your mission indicates. "

Reviews.Title: “Great Valentine's Day Escape!”
Reviews.Author: Becky91681
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mandarin for 4 nights over President's day weekend. Prior to visiting the concierge was extremely helpful making restaurant reservations and answering any question I had. They even sent a birthday cake to our parents room since I told the concierge our group was celebrating a birthday. The service was top notch, everyone was extremely friendly and helpful. Ambar restaurant was fantastic, as was the breakfast by the beach. They are about 20 minutes away from Playa Del Carmen, which is cute/touristy place to dinner and shop around. Other than that, I would suggest eating at the hotel and next door at the Rosewood. The concierge arranged a day trip for us to see Tulum. We decided to take a taxi from the hotel and find a guide when we got there. This saved us a bunch of money rather than selecting a pre-set tour from the hotel. My only suggestion would be to add more golf carts to the property since it is very long and spread out. We really enjoyed ourselves!!!

Reviews.Title: “Would go back in a nano second.”
Reviews.Author: WAS215
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter and I had spend four nights at the Mandarin last week and it was one of the best hotels we have ever stayed at (and we travel a lot). The physical plant is beautiful, the food great, but what makes it so special is the staff who are wonderful. On one the days we were there my wife and I went scuba diving leaving our 15 year old daughter at the resort , who an hour got sick to her stomach in view of several staff members. Instead of feeling embarrassed the staff told her it was no big deal, and after escorting her back to our suite checked in on her several times to make sure she was okay. Not only did the staff go beyond the call of duty that day but continued to ask about her health for the remainder of our stay (she recovered quickly). Again a great hotel in a great location with a terrific and genuine staff.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect beach getaway!”
Reviews.Author: 4texastravelers
Reviews.Content: We had originally planned to stay at another hotel in the Riviera Maya, but after reading helpful reviews on Tripadvisor and recommendations from other reviewers we ended up booking at the Mandrian Oriental and I'm very happy we did. The hotels layout & design is very unique and different compared to the standard beach resorts in Mexico. We stayed in the Premier Palafito room and it was fabulous accommodations. The private roof top terrace had breath taking views and the outdoor bathtub was lovely. I would say the beach concierge service that was provided at the resort was absolute perfection and worth going back just for that!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money - expected better”
Reviews.Author: xangel77
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for a week to celebrate our 1 year anniversary. We picked this hotel because we stayed at the MO in Chang Mai Thailand during our honyemoon and it is the most amazing hotel on the planet. We figured this would be great and much closer to home. Sorry to say but we were very disappointed and will not go back. For a new hotel built less then 2 years ago it just didn't seem very new looking at all. It seemed unkept actually and like the staff was neglecting it. The lawn care and gardening should have been better, there were lights out all over the property, one section of the long pathway smelled like sewage and we had water temperature problems in our shower. We had a palaofito room which was very nice and close walk to the beach but while taking a shower our water would get burning hot every 5 seconds! Very dangerous especially if you have kids. We complained about this problem 4 times before maintenance finally tried to fix it and they couldn't. They offered us a different room but we didn't take it because it was in the middle of the property and we liked the location of our room because unless you are by the beach you are in for A LOT of walking. The property is long and narrow and a far walk from the lobby or spa to get to the beach. We are young and very active so we didn't mind so much but I could see how this would be terrible for people not looking for exercise on their vacation. The hotel was less then 50 % full and there was more staff then needed yet we still had to wait a long time for everything. We were always waiting for golf carts and the food always took forever to come out even when we were the only people ordering! And SO expensive it is ridiculous. Also not enough dining options. While we were there Ambar was the only dinner option besides room service and the food is excellent but it is fine dining so kind of fancy and very expensive we were there for a week so we couldn't eat there every night! Ceviche is the only lunch option and we did not care for that menu at all. Not enough options. My husband and I don't eat ceviche or sushi so after that the options are very limited. We would walk on the beach to other hotels for lunch. The spa was beautiful but that was also a disappointment because the steam room was broken 3 out of the 7 days we were there and both the men and womens side! We wanted to get Thai massages and the only masseuse who could do those was pregnant. They said they would look into getting someone else in and no one ever told us anything. At the MO in Chang Mai we would have gotten a phone call or note in our room later that day but here they didn't even mention anything the next 10 times they saw us! We booked thai massages at the Banyan Tree hotel which had just opened about 6 month ago. THAT IS THE PLACE TO STAY IF YOU GO TO RIVIERA MAYA!!! When we go back we will definitely be staying at the Banyan Tree hotel.
