Reviews.Title: “Be prepared to feel a little bit of Bali!”
Reviews.Author: sebnemnyc
Reviews.Content: WOW - what more do you need to know? WOWOWOWOWOW. If you are thinking about staying here vs the Mayakoba - book the MANDARIN! Do Not Waste Your Time elsewhere. Every single thing about this property is INCREDIBLE. 1) The lobby, well you can't really call it a lobby because it's outdoors, is a huge hut surrounded by water. 2) We got upgraded to a fantastic villa close to the beach on the lagoon. Our room was beautiful but the best part with the indoor/outdoor bathroom which lights up at night. 3) The property itself is full of lush vegetation. If you want to get in some cardio, skip the golf cart rides and walk/jog to the beach, restaurant, spa, etc. 4) The service was excellent and every staff member greats you. 5) THE SPA - this spa does not exisit eleswhere! I want to design my house like it! It beat out the spa at the Four Season Istabul which is not easy to do!

Reviews.Title: “Why stay here when the Rosewood Mayakoba's right next door?”
Reviews.Author: DaneP
Reviews.Content: Mandarin Oriental must be terribly embarrassed by this foray of theirs into the beach resort world--it just wasn't thought out well at all. The rooms are perfectly lovely, as are the Bulgari bath products, and the food was consistently good. But the resort itself? There's one totally unimpressive pool deck, with a freezing cold rectangular pool. In two days on that pool deck, the service was virtually non-existent. Compare this to the Rosewood next door, in which every 30-45 minutes we were brought some new delight to enjoy poolside, all complimentary, and the main pool area is spectacularly beautiful, with bath-tub warm water and wonderful design features, as well as an infinity pool by the beach and a terrific beach-side restaurant. Plus, at the Rosewood, every room, even the basic one I had, had a private dock and a gorgeous view, whereas most of the Mandarin's rooms are in blocks and clusters like condominiums--nothing unique or special about the design of them. The spa was nice at the Mandarin. It's an ok resort, but I really don't know why anyone would ever stay there when the Rosewood is right next door and is so much more impressive on every count.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Mandarin Property I've ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: businesssavy
Reviews.Content: If you like having to call maintenance every time you use the bathroom, this is the hotel for you! Or if you want the maintenance crew to share a room with you the entire week, check out this resort! This is by far the worst Mandarin I have stayed at, besides the executive management-Patrick Finet-General Manager, and the Resident General Manager.... I have never had a worse experience in my life. We had a wedding here and I would strongly urge if you are considering a wedding, please do so at the Mayakoba/Rosewood, Ritz Carlton, or the Tides. Our guests had to endure no running water and had to be shuttled to the spa to take showers, the A/C at the resort does not go below 78 degrees (our elderly guests got ill) -they bring fans in, the toilets overflowed in several rooms on a "more than once" a day basis, a piece of the concrete fell out of the wall in one of the guest suites and almost broke someone's foot, a guest was locked out of their bedroom for a half hour after the turn down service came in and did something weird to the door! The management will not work with you to negotiate anything, and they are not short of being sleazy and uncooperative. The General Manger rides around on a motorized bicycle that says "The Boss"-if that says it all. In staying at the Tides-which is a beautiful, 5 star service oriented resort, I was shocked that the Mandarin fell short of even coming close to a 5 star. We stay on a normal basis for travel/business at the Four Seasons, Taj, Ritz Carlton, Loews, Mandarin US, etc on a regular basis-and this was HORRIBLE. We are not the type of people that ever complain... In fairness, the food was okay and the service was ok, but the infrastructure and engineering of the resort was terrible. Please check out other resorts if you want to venture to Mexico-which considering the swine flu and the drug cartel issues-they haven't slashed prices too much and will not work with you to upgrade on rooms/deals, despite what you may think..... Please reconsider your choice and never have a wedding here....The experience that we had here was unacceptable and management would not work with us in a friendly manner-after bringing in a group of four CEO's in our party to meet with the GM, he would not negotiate and said what he said goes and that's it b/c it's his property! We had to get a US Mandarin on the phone for assistance with the matter. It was a sickening experience and I cannot stress it enough what they put us through. Our wedding was the second one they've ever done here, and the wedding coordinator of the Mandarin, the GM, and the Resident GM made it as unpleasant as they could and tried to cheat us on price to make up for the bottom line on the money they are losing. The occupancy rate when we stayed here was 35% and they would not upgrade the bride and groom to a suite-we were charged and asked to sign a contract paying an additional 1500 a night..... When we did upgrade, there was no AC working in the room and bathroom and my stylist and makeup artist I brought from the US could not work in those conditions-six additional fans were brought into the bathroom/vanity area and the electric fuse blew..... I was unable to get ready in my room..... We changed rooms three times while being there! I could go on and on, but you get the drift.... If you are looking for a Mandarin and are traveling from the US, keep it in the states.... We were disappointed and so were our guests... Also, if you want to get hosed on pricing and pay more for low grade quality, here's your chance.... Please reconsider a wedding for sure, definately a vacation....

Reviews.Title: “OUT OF THIS WORLD!!!!”
Reviews.Author: florecienta
Reviews.Content: This hotel has surpassed all expectations we had!! We were celebrating our anniversary here and we were treated like royalty!!!! We got a free upgrade to Palafitos Premier room and received more than one complementary bottle of wine... it was amazing!! To sum up why I think this hotel was great here are some points: 1.) THE HOTEL-- this hotel is beautiful! The rooms are decorated in modern furnishings and all include a bathroom to die for! We had an outdoor tub that was filled with salts and bubbles upon your request. Also, the grounds are a natural beauty, filled with beautiful paths and scenic views 2.) THE RESTAURANTS-- we could not have eaten better!! We love sushi and ceviches and were so glad to find that the beach restaurant offered so much variety of these, they were delicious! Also, the main restaurant Ambar offered a selection of Mexican-Asian fusion dishes that constantly surprised us. You can't miss the foie gras appetizer as well!!! 3.) THE SERVICE-- The waiters at the Mandarin Oriental are among the best we have ever seen (we have been to a couple of hotels in Maldives and Asia and these were even better). Also, they arranged a private dinner at the beach to celebrate our anniversary which turned out beautiful. Everyone also called us by our name!! 4.) THE SPA--- THIS IS A MUST!! We were extremely astonished by the facilites at the spa. The vapor room, the sauna, the massage pools, the experience shower.... the couple's room for a massage. This Spa is among the best in all of Latin America. If you are a spa lover, this is the hotel for you!! Finally, the last thing that made our stay amazing was the fact that the hotel was fairly empty. I know that this is bad for the hotel industry but it was AMAZING for us!! To all of those wondering if it is safe to travel to the Mandarin Oriental Riviera Maya-- it is!!!! And... best of all is that if you travel soon, you will have even more privacy and facilites ALL FOR YOURSELVES!!! p.s. they are offering amazing offers (nights free, resort credit) so take advantage of it, who knows how much longer it will last!!!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury on the Mayan Riviera”
Reviews.Author: MK2009Manhattan
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 5 luxurious days at the Mandarin with a group of friends, and the hotel certainly lived up to my high expectations. The rooms were spacious and elegantly decorated, and I especially loved the huge bathtub on my terrace and the ultra-comfortable beds. The ground were also gorgeous, and I liked the way it was integrated into the natural setting. The service was impeccable. The staff was very friendly without being obtrusive, and I liked that they almost always greeted you by name. They were extremely helpful in meeting our every need. And I looked forward to the nightly amenities, which ranged from margaritas to petit fours to Mayan momentos. Although it was tempting to just stay at the beautiful resort everyday, the staff was also very helpful in arranging excursions outside of the resort. We spent one day at Chichen Itza with a wonderful and very knowledgeable guide (Vicente) that the hotel arranged for us. I also spent a day diving in the ceynotes with the on-site dive shop, which was a unique and amazing experience. I had a wonderful and very relaxing time at the Mandarin, and I would certainly reommend this resort to anyone looking for a luxurious getaway

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great service, no intimacy though”
Reviews.Author: loxxx
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family of 2 little kids at the Mandarin Riviera Maya for four days. We had a regular room, with garden and outside hot tub. The room was ok allthough my 1 yr old son had to sleep in the bathroom! THe design and comfort of the room was great, everything you expect for paying $900 per night. We dined in a couple of times and the staff was more then friendly, great food and great service. The beach and pool are super, dont expect anything like ritz kids paradise but size of the pool is ok. I would not recommend going without kids since they rule the pools. Beach was beautiful, Miami like. THe only thing the hotel misses is intimacy and charm. Everything is brand new, built top notch design, but is misses a cosy bar, nice restaurants etc. It takes a ten minute walk on average from your room to the beach and there are golf karts everywhere. If you want to be anonymous, this is the place!

Reviews.Title: “Paraiso en Mexico”
Reviews.Author: nycbelle212
Reviews.Content: I will truly treasure the week I spent at the hotel celebrating my 40th birthday with my sisters. Being familiar with Mandarin Oriental's standards, I knew I would have a wonderful time, that the property would be beautiful and the service excellent. However, from beginning to end, everything about my time there exceeded my expectations. Although I enjoyed the beautiful and luxurious accommodations, the gorgeous grounds and the spectacular views, it was all the little thoughtful touches taken that made my stay so special. More specifically, when I arrived at the hotel and got out of my car, a woman greeted me, offered me a cool, wet washcloth and escorted me to the front desk. After being seated, I was offered my choice of assorted fresh fruit juices to drink during the checking in process. My driver then drove me on the cart to my room, acting as tour guide along the way. Each person along the way knew it was my birthday and made a point of wishing me a happy birthday. My room was very simply but beautifully appointed. The bed and sofa were comfortable, the amenities (Bulgari) were lovely, and the entertainment system was excellent (in addition to the usual cable offerings, you can also watch dvds which you can get from the concierge or plug in your ipod). The deck overlooked the lagoon, where, reportedly crocodiles live although I did not catch a glimpse of them during my 6 night stay. The upper deck had two lounge chairs and a view of the ocean and I could see all the way to Cozumel. The service level was incomparable. I was traveling with one of my sisters who is allergic to onions and garlic, which are difficult to avoid in Mexican cooking. When we informed our server of this dietary restriction, he took down my sister's name and clearly informed other staff because every other time we went to the restaurant, they were aware of this restriction. Without our asking, when we ordered guacamole, the kitchen sent out an additional serving of guacamole made without garlic and onions so that my sister could also eat. The staff at the pool in particular were very friendly and attentive to our needs. Without hovering, they always seemed to be available when we needed anything. I highly recommend the spa at the hotel. There are a wide variety of treatments available and the attendants there are terrific. Again, the staff was very attentive, explaining all the facilities and recommending heat and water therapies to enhance whatever treatment you choose. In particular, the Vitality Pool was a refreshing experience. I know some people had issues with the length of the resort, but I was not really bothered by it. I was in a Premier Palafito room, which is quite close to the beach. Almost every day, I walked to the business center located in the lobby of the hotel or the gym (very close to the lobby) and it took about 10-15 minutes. However, drivers in golf carts patrolled the camino principal (the route that runs from the lobby throughout the resort to the beach) regularly and you can also call to have a cart pick you up at any time. It is clear that a lot of thought and attention to every detail was given to make this a luxurious resort. I had an amazing, memorable experience.

Reviews.Title: “humungous, minimalistic, fair”
Reviews.Author: luxustussi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the MO Riviera Maya during the peak New Years week in Jan ‘09. The first impression at reception was positive but quickly turned into suspiciousness when we were driven to our room: the buggy-journey just seemed endless. Soon we realized that the resort is vast, build of several villa- and two-storey bungalow-complexes alongside a narrow path that stretches over 1,5 kilometers from reception to the Beach-Restaurant. ROOMS: Our room was by the Laguna which resembled more an excavation filled with water surrounded by two-storey bungalows. Seen that these are built in a circle, we easily figured who our neighbors were. So much about privacy. Our room had all mod cons but definitely lacking a final touch in terms of decoration. A lot of bare walls and unfilled space. The bathroom was proportionally big and space consuming, even had two showers but no bidet or indoors bathtub. The private outside bathroom-patio had a large concrete plunge-pool/bath which could only be filled by housekeeping upon request. Apart from that: no plant, no stool for towels or clothes, no table. Definitely an area to develop. GASTRONOMY: The food and drinks definitely need to increase their price/value relationship (Guacamole is $10, a Beefburger $24, a bottle of Evian $11). Cuisine is good but not amazing considering the prices. In a country where food is not expensive, it is inappropriate to see such high prices for such average offers. Seen that the resort is right by the beach there is not a huge offer on fresh fish or “catch of the day”. The Ceviche Cha Cha Restaurant however offers great Ceviche and Sushi on the beach. The casual Aquamarine Restaurant by the pools is a concrete hall inspired by 70's neo-futuristic architecture. The menu for lunch and dinner are equal. The inside is very minimalistic and the music played can be acoustically straining. The more quiet outside space does not offer a lot of tables for dinner although there would be enough space for many more tables. We had to wait until a table became free and eventually ordered food to be delivered to our room which was delivered “hot” 45 minutes thereafter. Alternatively we could have walked over to the more up-market Ambar Restaurant. A 15% service charge is added to each bill, whichever restaurant or service provided. A plus is that the MO is close to town (Playa del Carmen), the transport cost (and time) allows multiple journeys to try other restaurants. STAFF: The overall service was coming up to MO-standards. Waiting-staff is friendly but when usually one or two waiters should be responsible for one restaurant-area here everyone seems responsible for all areas – too many cooks spoil the broth. When you order the same beverage for breakfast every morning I would expect by the 3rd or 4th day for staff to anticipate this need. This all sounds very over the top and a very high bar to expect of its staff, and it is just illustrative, but their competitors do it. Also, we were told one morning that breakfast is included while it clearly wasn’t. OTHER: Mandarin Oriental Riviera Maya has very "adult" approach. However, the week we were there, many children were present. The pool area is too small (and dangerous) for small, running, screaming youngsters. There does not seem to be enough space or activities for them to be entertained and it was clear that the parents did not want to be bothered. While the MO is not responsible for laissez-faire parenting, they need to preserve the ambience for all guests, not just for the under 10's. The beach is fairly narrow and not private. Both pools are considerably small for such a large resort so we experienced a daily battle to get hold of a deckchair on the beach. Beach-casita-guests have priority on beach-deckchairs while most other guests blocked theirs by leaving a towel or book on a deckchair in the early morning and return at a later point. This situation however changed towards the end of our stay when many guests had checked out as peak season was over. Loud music from the beach-restaurant can occasionally be alienating. On two occasions we had a saxophonist playing life music accompanied by tacky synthesizer sounds while walking around the pool - we found that really irritating and felt like being in a retirement home, not a luxury resort.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous tranqual property, great for a few days, but,”
Reviews.Author: jadesdad
Reviews.Content: Second stay at this wonderful property. The rooms are generous, the staff very friendly, and the facilities top notch. The problems start with the hype. The property was only about 40% filled and if there were any more guests the staff would have a nervous breakdown dealing with everyone. This may be a Mandarin in name and pricing, but other than management, the staff, while having the best of intentions and heart, just are not up to dealing with the demands of a world class five star hotel. This is true of the pool, concierge and restaurant facilities. The only exception is the spa which has it all down pat; truly some of the most professional and competent anywhere. The other complaint is that the hotel cannot decide if it is a family hotel or a couples hotel. The facilities such as the spa and restaurants are just beautiful, but the pool area is VERY small and if filled with families, just not the place you want to spend any time. The beach is nice, but also small and not large enough to handle a lot of kids. We would definitely come back, and the hotel has progressed in many areas from last year when it opened, but at this price, there are many, many, many choices in the world to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience!!”
Reviews.Author: carlost75
Reviews.Content: I recently had the immense pleasure to stay at this hotel for a few days of very much needed rest and relaxation. The hotel itself is spectacular. When you reach the lobby you can feel and the see the regalness of this hotel and from the point of my arrival to the point of my departure I was treated like royalty. I have to say that yes, the hotel is fabulous, but the quality of service that was given to me was beyond anything I had ever expected. I stayed in a beach front casita with wonderful amenities and 24 hour butler service. The view was unreal! The casita offered plenty of privacy especially on the rooftop that had a private pool and sweeping views of the sea and the mangroves surrounding the hotel. The highlight of this place has to be the Spa. I had the best massage and facial that really brought me to the ultimate height of relaxation. The aesthetics of the spa is also phenomenal. I truly felt transported to some asian destination. The food was very very good. I had the BEST sushi I had ever tasted at the restaurant called Ceviche ChaChaCha. Ambar Restaurant is the classiest of restaurants with uncomparable tasting food. Once again, I must stress that the level of service was outstanding in every part of the hotel but it was best reflected at the restaurants. I highly recommend staying at this luxurious hotel if you want to rest and get away from the hustle and bustle of the city. I give the Mandarin Oriental Riviera Maya 5 stars!!!

Reviews.Title: “Truly amazing..........words can't describe.”
Reviews.Author: pattyatips
Reviews.Content: I have been fortunate to stay in some of the best properties over the years but I believe this place tops them all. The service is absolute perfection, the room was spacious and spectacular with every amenity thought of and the property is beautiful and VERY sexy. This place has this zen quality to it with amazing views and just gives off this incredibly romantic vibe. Food was outstanding. We were in a selva room with the outdoor plunge pool and it was fantastic.........one call and they came to draw a bath with several choices for aromatherapy. You simply cannot go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in the world - already planing return trip.”
Reviews.Author: mmesnack
Reviews.Content: This has the perfect balance of relaxed luxury. The resort is built in a way that you don't really see people. Cerviche bar was excellent. The beach from casitas are spectacular - with a private sun deck and dip pool, butler and great bathrooms. Was a perfect vacation. This is one of my top three hotels now with Raffles Singapore and Blackberry Farm in TN.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Service!”
Reviews.Author: MelAtlanta_Georgia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 5 night stay at the Mandarin Riviera Maya and it was absolutely astounding. We had nothing but wonderful experiences, exemplary service, great food and all the benefits that the beautifully serene surroundings of this hotel can offer. We were amazed at how positive, friendly and helpful every single staff member was. No one passed us by without a friendly hello and a smile. Our deluxe lagoon room was extremely large and beautifully appointed...made the Ritz Carlton we stayed at in Cancun look like the Holiday Inn! The views of the lagoon were very relaxing and every aspect of the room was very private. We dined at the Spa Cafe most days for lunch - be sure to try the hummus wrap! We had a lovely dinner at Ambar and some wonderful champagne creations before at the wonderful rooftop bar. We only left the property on a few occasions but, if you are looking for a convenient and reasonably priced snorkeling spot (just about 30 minutes away in Akumal) and need a taxi, be sure to request Alexander for your ride. He is a driver for the hotel's preferred taxi service.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the MO - What an Amazing Vacation”
Reviews.Author: ktina69
Reviews.Content: This was a once in a lifetime vacation! The property was absolutely beautiful, the staff was friendly and attentive, and the food was outstanding. I would highly recommend the Ambar restaurant. The menu was unique and the food was delicious. I would highly suggest that anyone schedule this property into their vacation itinerary.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: brian714
Reviews.Content: Everything was pretty much above average. A few mosquito on my deck made sitting outside at night tough. Deluxe Laguna rooms on upper levels have deck and views of the lagoons and rivers throughout the property. lower level rooms have small yards with lawn chairs, they views were not that great so next time I'd pay more and get a small yard to hang out in. Besides the patio deck was too hot in the daytime, no shade and too small to move loungers around if you want to get a tan. I hate the location of the Palafito rooms, no privacy, you can see right in them from the pool area and walking area. Not worth the extra money if you ask me. Some room locations closer to the lobby are nice. Mini bar prices are outrageous but I guess it's all about convenience. They give plenty of free bottled water each morning and night. Voss water on the bedside at evening turn down was nice. The GYM next to the spa offers free bottle water 24-7 so never buy water at this resort, in fact I think they offer Gatorade free there too. SPA was awesome - best Swedish massage I have ever had. Foot scrub I'd rate a c-. Men's facials c- just not good. breakfast at aqua marina - continental breakfast is terrific, lots of choices. hot buffet is an add on price and nice but nothing special. I'd go with the cold buffet. I did order a few times off the menu and the omelets and waffles are good but not terrific. Ambar - I don't really understand this restaurant. Overpriced! And trust me I love to spend money. The menu was strange and not crave-able in a Mexican climate. I've almost never been anywhere where nothing sounds good Ambar was the first. I don't see this place staying the same for long. It was dead each evening. The rooftop is a cool hip bar on the roof, it's fun and romantic. GO THERE AT LEAST ONCE. MAIN POOL at aqua Marina - They should keep screaming kids out of there, that can ruin a day of R&R. Now there were few to no kids but one bad one can and did spoil a day by the pool. By the way hotel was only 40% full the week I was there. Very quiet. ground transportation: I'm 30 something and in great shape, love to run and walk, this resort is large and it's a long walk from the lobby to the beach, about a mile I think. They have golf carts going by all the time, most are room service or gardeners and not taxis so that's a bit annoying but again I am fit and young and like to walk otherwise I'd be pissed. I do know that you can call for a ride before leaving your room and they will come right away. They could improve on the frequency of the taxi cart. All drivers are very friendly. If I have to be petty, the railings were all cracking and in major need of a sanding and staining. The resort is fairly new and looks like it's been there for years. They are going to have to keep this up a bit better. Now I am not saying it's trashed by any means I am just anal about these things. lot's of burnt out bulbs around the property, 2 in my room that I asked twice to be replaced but never happened. Room service - slow overpriced and not good. If you ever want a good steak and some great side items go over to the Rosewood next door and eat at their casual poolside restaurant. Great food and much less pricey than Mandarin. I'll be honest food at MO was not that great, good but not great. Overall would I stay here again?? Yes I would but I'd want to try out Rosewood next door too. I took a small tour that was offered when we went there one night to eat and the grounds are spectacular, but almost too overwhelming. Much bigger property than MO and if you have issues walking MO may be better. I think the rooms at Rosewood are better. Mandarian does have a smaller, more private feel after comparing the two. IF you are into the beach, the best , cleanest beach in the riveria maya are is by far at right in front of MANDARIAN . People walking by all day from the other resorts and gawk at how nice the beach, beach chair, palm trees and swanky resort look.

Reviews.Title: “Not Quite Mandarin Level”
Reviews.Author: AmanJunkieBoston
Reviews.Content: The rooms are fantastic, the service is also quite good relative to the region, and the food was very good. The one key issue is the small pool area and the T structure of the grounds with rooms potentially quite distant from the beach. That said, in the Caribbean or Mexico, it is so difficult to get good food and good service, and the Mandarin had both.

Reviews.Title: “Close but no cigar”
Reviews.Author: like2travelNY
Reviews.Content: The Good: rooms were nice and spacious and pristine / staff always willing to please / spa was nice The Bad: pool area too small / too many small kids / (we have teenagers) too many staff members couldn't understand English or speak it well The Ugly: the layout of this place is atrocious -- it's built perpendicular to the beach so that depending on where your room is you could have (no exaggeration) a 25 min walk to the beach / the golf cart shuttles came by infrequently to drive you where you wanted to go and we saw many guests with exacerbated looks on their faces -- by the end of the trip we had enough of it (at the rosewood (next door) they seem to have the golf cart system down a little bit better) We stayed at the Maroma last year and if we were to return to this area, we would try and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: SSemone
Reviews.Content: This hotel is overpriced in my opinion. If you are into the techno look then this might be for you. If you are into creature comforts and plush surroundings then this is not for you. I did not stay here for more than 15 minutes and I have to say that since I was not happy the hotel let me leave with NO penalty. I have to say that I give them big kudos for that. I do not want to say that it is a bad hotel because it is not-- it is just not as opulent as other hotels in its same price range. The suite I was in was supposed to be 700+ square feet-- and it was, but half of it was the bathroom. While it is nice to have a huge bathroom, the rest of the room should not suffer because of it. I ate one dinner there before I left and the food was fantastic. The staff was excellent. There is nothing more they could have done for me, but I was not impressed with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay - lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: wreckles
Reviews.Content: Stunning property in a great location. We stayed 3 nights and that is probably enough if you only remain within the confines of the hotel. Service is impeccable - as you would expect in one of their properties. Maybe worth packing in some citronella candles or mosquito coils as the hotel only provides repellant. Beware also that service charge is added onto everything - even taxi's they book for you!

Reviews.Title: “Ultimate Luxury and Pampering at the Mandarin Oriental”
Reviews.Author: bubadd
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were prepared to be wowed, but our stay exceeded our expectations! The rooms are gorgeous and very spacious, the bathroom is beautiful and the outdoor tub is an experience that we thoroughly enjoyed. The rooms are extremely private, we stayed in a deluxe laguna and we felt like we were in our own private villa in the jungle. Granted the hotel was very slow but we were treated like royalty. Anything we asked for, was immediately taken care of. The only thing we didnt love was how far everything is from one another. You definitely need to call for transportation (I certainly did, being 8 months pregnant), which they send fairly quickly. The pool was stunning, the service at the pool was EXTREMELY attentive, the spa was one of the nicest we've ever been to. There isn't much to do in Riviera Maya but we were looking to relax and that's precisely what we did. Highly reccomended!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent BUt not for young families”
Reviews.Author: twinings
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful weeks stay.I agree that it may not be up to the levels of service you get in asia but they really do try . My one point is that the hotel should decide who they realy want to attract. The pool area is small and when a young family arrives it destroys the quite relaxed elegance of the place.Also the long linear layout makes it awkward to get about and this must be a nuisance if you have small kids. So i strongly recommend going to this hotel but got outside of school holidays. Note to hotel: think seriously do you want to attract young families if it means hacking off the other guests.

Reviews.Title: “A little bit strange”
Reviews.Author: buena1vista1
Reviews.Content: I did not stay in that hotel YET, I wanted to book BUT: for me it's a very strange that on their website you see the price but have to add an extra of: 10% VAT 2% Government fee 15% service charge For me that doesn't make a good "picture" if I state a price on which you have to add 27 % (!!!!!!) more which is with the lowest rate of USD 559,-- quite a lot. EXACTLY PLUS USD 150,93 MORE! per night!!!!! First class hotel OK, but FIRST CLASS HONESTY would be better!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Mandarin Oriental”
Reviews.Author: nycbird
Reviews.Content: My stay in Mandarin Oriental Riviera Maya.... The first time I stayed in a Mandarin Oriental Hotel was in Hong Kong , it was wonderful but it was like 16 years ago... then I stayed in Washington and New York and also I had a wonderful time, this time we decide to go to Mexico and when I saw that there is a Mandarin Oriental in Playa del Carmen I called and asked for the best suggestion as the hotel has very different kind of rooms... but i reserved the one I liked the most with the description I got, a lagoon room for two nights ( we jump from one hotel to another to try different concepts ) when we arrived i was shocked with the beauty of the place... I just loved it... a diver took us to our room and he explained us about the hotel and what they offer to the guests... when we got to our room it was even prettier than the pictures my husband got with our confirmation e mail. Service is excellent, food couldn`t be better, spa we loved it and the employees are extremely kind and helpful, the only comments that i have beside the good ones are the small technical issues that we had in our room and the consequences, we just wanted to relax not to constantly be contacted to remember us that we had a problem, I know we did... from the time we got there until the time we left , I felt that I was being over informed from the complaints manager the compensations we got for the problems we encountered when We were not looking for anything like that. What I liked the most is: the design of the hotel and the decoration, the spa, the spa and the spa, the small restaurant in the spa, my bed, breakfast in the garden of my room and in general we liked it a lot, and I already want to book our room for our next vacation, and for more days.

Reviews.Title: “Very Expensive Drinks”
Reviews.Author: pureshot
Reviews.Content: Did not stay at the Hotel. We had dinner at their main beach restaurant. Nice view and the food was ok. When I got the bill I was shocked how much they charged for premium drinks. $18 plus tip. I felt that was robbery and ruined the event. If you want to charge that kind of money make it known in advance. I felt ripped off and pissed. I can't rate the hotel itself as we stayed next door.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury on the Mayan Riviera”
Reviews.Author: GKNConnecticut
Reviews.Content: I just returned with my wife and three teenage children from Paradise. We had undoubtedly the finest 10 days of our lives at the Mandarin in Playa del Carmen. We have stayed in some of the best hotels in the world, particularly some of the finest resort hotels in Asia and we put this hotel at the top of our list. Management is exceptional, service incredible, an amazing spa and excellent food and beverage. We felt completely spoiled from morning to night. The setting is fantastic with a nice beach on the Mexican Caribbean. The Mandarin has a first class scuba diving operation - we did reef dives as well as a privately guided Cenote dive. Parasailing, jet skis and sailing are available (for a fee). The staff is lovely and ultra attentive. The concierge was terrific in arranging a privately guided trip to Chichen Itza as well as zip-lining through the forest canopy. He was also helpful with dinner recommendations and reservations in Playa del Carmen (fun, but very touristy) and at other hotels. At the Mandarin, food and beverage is excellent and creative, but somewhat pricey. Rooms are gorgeous and fairly priced, especially during the summer. Overall, I recommend this hotel without hesitation. If you want to be pampered in ultra luxury in an incredible setting, then this is the hotel for you. I am a fan! Six stars!!

Reviews.Title: “Blissful Mandarin Oriental”
Reviews.Author: Stuart59
Reviews.Content: After waiting several years for this resort to open, we finally made it to MO Riviera Maya and had a wonderful experience. The staff was extremely attentive and friendly. I often wondered if there was anything I could possibly ask for, to which the answer would be "No". The rooms were simply amazing - not just huge and luxurious, but very interesting. We were upgraded to a Selva Villa. We had our own secluded garden with a giant outdoor tub. The resort is beautifully set among mangroves, and intertwined with cenotes, canals and lagoons. Nothing, other than thick mangrove forest is visible from the resort. Wild animals and magnificent birds are abundant. The eclectic courtyards and landscaping were stunning. Excellent food at all three restaurants, including stunning ocean views from the Aguamarine sun deck. Lots of great activities - Mayan Ruins, swimming with whale sharks, diving in underground caves.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the atmosphere and Spa”
Reviews.Author: FrozenCid
Reviews.Content: I have returned from Riviera Maya very happy and delighted with all I ve seen and experienced in this great region. The hotel is so Fantastic and intimate, surrounded by mother nature with mangroves, canals, cenotes and a nice beach. I did not expect to find so many great attractions in one single place... 10m from Playa del Carmen, a charming village to get around in the evening, with shops and bars, restaurants and beautiful people. Only 30m by car from the airport, and easy access to all the major cultural attractions like the mayans archeological sites. Outside the hotel, the cenotes diving was The Best attraction I experienced. Couldn't imagine by all the photos I had seen, that it was such an amazing and pleasant experience. Really above my expectations, but you need to find the right guide for that. Ours was from the hotel, and has chosen the exact and best time to be there...when the excursionists were arriving, we were already on our way back. Just a few of us there diving...really nice. The hotel is really a secluded hideaway resort in such a place that can be crowded sometimes. The SPA is wonderful, but did not appreciate that much the temazcal...too much. Food is great, balance between the spicy mexican with the asian tastes, a great mix. Beach service is wonderful and the service is great and friendly, as you can expect in a Mandarin Oriental hotel.
